title: TLSA Generator
subtitle: Create TLSA (DNS-based Authentication of Named Entities) records for certificate pinning and DANE implementation.

domain.label: Domain:
domain.tooltip: Domain name for the TLSA record

port.label: Port:
port.tooltip: Port number for the service (e.g., 443 for HTTPS, 25 for SMTP)

usage.label: Certificate Usage:
usage.tooltip: Certificate usage - how the certificate should be used for authentication

descriptions.0: CA Constraint - Certificate must be issued by the CA represented in the TLSA record
descriptions.1: Service Certificate Constraint - Certificate must match the one in the TLSA record
descriptions.2: Trust Anchor Assertion - Certificate must chain to the CA in the TLSA record
descriptions.3: Domain-Issued Certificate - Certificate must match the one specified (most common)

selector.label: Selector:
selector.tooltip: Which part of the certificate to use

descriptions.0: Full Certificate - Use the entire certificate
descriptions.1: Subject Public Key Info - Use only the public key portion (recommended)

matchingType.label: Matching Type:
matchingType.tooltip: How to process the certificate data

descriptions.0: Exact Match - Use the certificate/key data as-is (not recommended)
descriptions.1: SHA-256 Hash - Use SHA-256 hash of the certificate/key (recommended)
descriptions.2: SHA-512 Hash - Use SHA-512 hash of the certificate/key

certificateInput.label: Certificate/Public Key:
certificateInput.tooltip: Paste the PEM-encoded certificate or public key

https.name: HTTPS Certificate Pin
https.description: Pin a specific certificate for HTTPS

errors.hashFormat: Hash must contain only hexadecimal characters

warnings.certificateFormat: Certificate should be in PEM format
warnings.sha256Length: SHA-256 hash should be exactly 64 hexadecimal characters
warnings.sha512Length: SHA-512 hash should be exactly 128 hexadecimal characters
warnings.caManagement: Usage types 0 and 2 require careful CA certificate management
warnings.fullCertificate: Full certificate selector (0) is less flexible than SPKI selector (1)
warnings.exactMatch: Exact match (0) is not recommended - use SHA-256 (1) or SHA-512 (2)

tips.usageType: Use usage type 3 (Domain-Issued Certificate) for most scenarios
tips.selector: Prefer selector 1 (SPKI) over selector 0 (full certificate) for flexibility
tips.matching: Use SHA-256 (1) or SHA-512 (2) matching types, avoid exact match (0)
tips.multiple: Pin multiple certificates to avoid service disruption during certificate rotation
tips.testing: Test TLSA records with DANE validation tools before deployment

about.title: About TLSA Records
about.description: TLSA records provide DNS-based certificate constraints for TLS connections. They enable DANE (DNS-based Authentication of Named Entities), allowing domain owners to specify which certificates should be trusted for their services, independent of traditional Certificate Authorities.
